arena

Class Map

  • java.lang.Object
    • arena.Map

  • public class Map
extends java.lang.Object
    Map
    Control an hexagonal matrix of terraints in which are placed all scenarios, items and robots. Make changes on it accordingly to requests made by the world and robots.
    Author:
    Karina Suemi Awoki, Renato Cordeiro Ferreira, Vinicius Nascimento Silva
    See Also:
    Action, World

    • Method Detail

      • genesis

        Base[] genesis(int nPlayers,
             java.util.Random rand)
         throws InvalidOperationException
        Create map to 'n' players.
        Parameters:
        nPlayers - Number of players
        rand - Random object to generate everything with the same seed
        Returns:
        List with nPlayer bases to be given to the players
        Throws:
        InvalidOperationException

      • insertArmy

        Robot insertArmy(java.lang.String name,
               Player player,
               int ID,
               java.lang.String pathToProg)
           throws SegmentationFaultException
        Create a new robot in the map. Make a new robot to the player 'player', with name 'name', putting it in the position (i,j) of the map, programmed with the assembly program defined by the file in 'pathToProg'.
        Parameters:
        player - Robot owner
        name - Name of the new robot
        pathToProg - Robot assembly program
        Returns:
        Inserted robot
        Throws:
        SegmentationFaultException

      • populate

        public int[] populate(Player p)
        This method returns the coordinates of an empty space around a given player's base.
        Parameters:
        p - Player
        Returns:
        An integer array with the x and the y coordinates close to the base

      • removeScenario

        Scenario removeScenario(int i,
                      int j)
        Remove a given robot from the map. Take out the robot from the map.
        Parameters:
        i - Vertical position
        j - Horizontal position
